fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Customer users are sent @mention emails even though they should not have access to the project. This may give them access to information that they should not have.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user without application access
 # Mention the user in a comment

h3. Expected Results
* Since the user does not have access they should not receive an email.

h3. Actual Results
* The user receives the email (as a Mentioned you notification) with details of the comment.

h3. Workarounds
* Do not mention the user if you do not wish for them to receive an email.
* Change the Project Permission "Browse projects" to *not* include "Any user logged in" and instead use roles, groups or users with specific application access.
fields.summary: @Mention emails sent to Customer users

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Searching with Text containing dash ( - ) with a space in front or two dashes after will not return any result. 

h3. *Testing*

||Actual String in Summary||Search String||Return any result?||
|AAA - BBB|AAA - BBB|(x)| 
|AAA -BBB|AAA -BBB|(/)| 
|AAA-BBB|AAA-BBB|(/)| 
|AAA- BBB|AAA- BBB|(/)|
|AAA-|AAA|(/)|
|AAA-B|AAA-|(/)|
|AAA-BBB-CCC|AAA-BBB-C|(x)|
|AAA-BBB-CCC|AAA-BBB-C*|(x)|

h3. *Notes*
It would appear that if there is an empty space in front of the search string, it will not return any results.
fields.summary: Searching with Text containing dash (-) will not return any result unless type in full

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Jira CLI add-on developed by Bob Swift, it exploits a side from the Rest API that allows for Default Issue Type Schemes to be deleted.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software 7.6.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
When connecting to the Jira CLI, run --action deleteIssueTypeScheme --id ${ISSUE_TYPE_SCHEME}, and add the id for the default issue type scheme

h3. Expected Results
Nothing happens and default issue type scheme is not deleted.
h3. Actual Results
Default issue type scheme is deleted.
 
h3. Notes

From UI or REST API documentation we don't report being able to delete default issue type schemes, but somehow the add-on is able to exploit it and deletes it.

h3.Workaround
Rather than using an existing IssueTypeScheme, reinjected the missing data for the "Default Issue Type Scheme" :

Insert Into FIELDCONFIGSCHEME values ('10000', 'Default Issue Type Scheme',NULL,'issuetype',NULL);

Insert Into FIELDCONFIGURATION values ('10000','Default Configuration for Issue Type','Default configuration generated by JIRA','issuetype',NULL;

select max(id)+1 from FIELDCONFIGSCHEMEISSUETYPE;

    88803 = select max(id)+1 from FIELDCONFIGSCHEMEISSUETYPE;
    Insert Into FIELDCONFIGSCHEMEISSUETYPE values ('88803',NULL,'10000','10000');
fields.summary: Ability to delete Default Issue Type Schemes with Jira CLI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users would like to display all the columns in Kanban Backlog.

For example:

Let's say user have the 3 column:

| To Do | In Progress | Done |

Also, user have the following status in the columns:

| To Do | In Progress | Done |
| Status 1 | Status 3 | Status 5 |
| Status 2 | Status 4 | Status 6 |

When user add the Status 1 to Status 4 to Kanban backlog, they would like the remaining column to be shown in Kanban backlog so other users can drag and drop issues from the other columns similar what's done in the Kanban board.


h3. Suggested Solution

Show remaining columns configured in Kanban board in Kanban backlog as well.


h3. Workaround 

Users can use Kanban backlog to drag and drop issues to a different column.
fields.summary: Show all the columns in Kanban backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When 2 groups with different case sensitivity are added to JIRA, JIRA treats the groups as single groups in Global permission page but treats the groups as 2 different groups with other functionality.

+How to reproduce+

# Create a group named *jira-test* in Internal directory and add a user named *john*
# Add a user named john2  and groups named *jira-Test* in LDAP.
# Add the LDAP to JIRA.
# Set the LDAP directory as the secondary user directory.
# Search for the users named *john* in Users page. We will see 2 users who 1 in jira-test group and another in jira-Test group.
# Access "Global permission page" and try to add jira-test group to "Browse Users" permission. JIRA will only show the jira-test group since the jira-Test group is from LDAP which is in lower user directory.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.10, JIRA 7.4


h3. Expected Results

JIRA shows 2 different group in search result.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA shows the group which is from the top most directory.


h3.Workaround

Use a different uniquely named group.
fields.summary: Unable to add group with different case sentitivity

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JQL context validation can execute third-party JQL statements which can be expensive. 
This is done as part of {{com.atlassian.jira.jql.operand.FunctionOperandHandler.validate}} method. 

h3. Environment
* JQL filter with 3rd party JQL providers: JQL-tricks, Script Runner, etc 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install  Script Runner (just an example)
# Create new JQL with following data and safe as a filter
{code}
issueFunction in subtasksOf('Project = "AG"')
{code}
# Creare new board using the mentioned filter
# Load any issue 

h3. Expected Results
JQL will be not executed

h3. Actual Results
JQL was  executed
 
h3. Notes
Potentially any JQL with long and complex statement will cause the problem. So we are aware of the following specific pattens in JQL:
* id in
* key in
* parent in
* filter in
* issue in
* issueFunction in

The following query will help you identifying those JQL function used as filter for Boards in your instance:
{code:SQL|borderStyle=solid}
// list of Boards with JQL filters
 select rv."ID", rv."NAME", sr.reqcontent from searchrequest sr, "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW" rv where rv."SAVED_FILTER_ID" = sr.id;
{code}

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: JQL context validation can execute third-party JQL statements which can be expensive

fields.description:
I think this is a regression. pasting does not work in visual mode, when focus is on the visual mode textarea.

steps to reproduce:
 # Log in to Jira 
 # press "create" to open new issue dialog
 # ensure that visual mode is selected in description
 # copy file from file browser (ctrl-c)
 # click on visual textarea, ensure that cursor is visible in that textarea
 # paste (ctrl+v) image onto visual textarea - only image name is pasted. image should be uploaded and should be inserted and visible in visual textarea

Now it behaves correctly in text mode:
 # switch to text mode
 # click on text mode textarea
 # paste image (ctrl+v) - image is uploaded, visible in uploaded image area and proper wiki markup is generated - this is correct behaviour

Note that pasting (ctrl+v) works when you click on create issue dialog (outside of visual mode textarea)

I've tested it and it worked in some 7.2.x Jira where RTE was opt-in, it didn't work in 7.3.9 and later Jira

It looks like regression
fields.summary: copy and paste images from file-browser does not work in RTE

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

When using Jira Software (version < 7.10) and following the UI prompts from the *Versions & licenses* to upgrade Jira, you ultimately upgrade *only* Jira Core. With the recent UI updates with Jira 7.10, this breaks icons and other interface features when accessing Jira Software functions.

Although Jira Core and Jira Software are not compatible when on different versions, this is not made clear in the UI. In fact, the workflow from * Versions & licenses* encourages customers to mismatch versions. Ultimately, this leads to a confusing and frustrating experience where Jira is ultimately left in a non-working state.

h3. Environment 
Jira Core 7.10 w/ Jira Software 7.9 or lower installed

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Install Jira Software 7.8
# Navigate to *Versions & licenses* and notice the message about upgrading
# Click *Download* next to Jira Core
#* A window pops up, with checkboxes that appear to indicate that Jira Software will also be upgraded as part of the process
# Click *Get installer*
# You are taken to the Jira Core download page. Download installer and run it.
# You are now running on the latest version of Jira Core, but still on your old version of Jira Software. At this point you’ll notice that project icons are missing, some text fields don’t work properly, and UI elements are missing colors.

h3. Expected Results 

The UI directs users to upgrade Jira Software or provides an otherwise non-breaking path.

h3. Actual Results 

 !1.png|thumbnail! 

 !2.png|thumbnail! 

 !3.png|thumbnail! 

 !4.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround 
Use the [Jira Software installer|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download] rather than the Jira Core installer.
fields.summary: Updating Jira Core through UI breaks icons

fields.description:
In the backlog of a Scrum board, Jira allows us to right-click on an issue and select "Split Issue". This ends up creating a new issue with a "Split to" link type on the original issue.

If the original issue has other issue links ("blocks", "relates to", etc.), those links are not copied over to the new issue. It would be beneficial if we had the ability to do this.
fields.summary: Retain Issue Links When Using "Split Issue" Feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3821].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 November 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#eeeeee|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We're excited to announce that Priority schemes were just shipped with Jira Software 7.6. As some of you have already noticed, 7.6 was released yesterday, and you can download it [here|https://pl.atlassian.com/software/jira/download].

*What we've built*

As mentioned in our previous update, after research, spikes, and user interviews, we've decided that introducing Priority schemes is the best solution for our customers. This feature uses a well-known administrative mechanism, and maintains a consistent experience.

*Further improvements*

We've put a lot of effort into delivering Priority schemes as early as possible to make it for the 15th anniversary. We've decided that some further improvements will be added after the Jira 7.6 release. These will include: REST APIs to manage priority schemes, the ability to copy the priority schemes, as well as some minor UI improvements. We're planning to release them in the following Jira version (most likely 7.7).

*Jira Service Desk*

We've been working closely with the Jira Service Desk team to understand the impact of Priority schemes on customers using Service Desk projects. We wanted to make sure that these customers receive the best experience when Priority schemes are introduced.
To achieve this goal, we've identified further work, and are scoping it specifically for Jira Service Desk.
To make this feature available for Jira Core and Jira Software customers as quickly as possible, we've decided to release it without the support for Service Desk projects. What it means is that admins will not be able to associate a priority scheme with a Service Desk project in the first version.
This capability will be released independently by the Jira Service Desk team. Tracked in JSDSERVER-1374

*Resolutions per issue type*

We're re-adding the previous update on Resolutions per issue type here so that it's not lost in the stream of comments on this suggestion. 
Resolutions per issue type is really a separate feature request which we'll prioritise independently. In order to track it properly, we've created a separate suggestion purely for Resolutions per issue type here: JRASERVER-65924.
In hindsight we should have separated the two a long time ago, but we promise we will use all the comments around resolutions from this suggestion in the design of the feature, so no need to put the same comments, just make sure to vote and watch the issue! We will provide further updates in there.

You can read more details regarding Priority schemes and other capabilities that we added in Jira Software 7.6 [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-6-x-release-notes-938027181.html].
As always, we would love to hear your feedback so feel free to reach out to me directly, or post a comment in this suggestion.

Cheers,
Jakub Lazinski
Product Manager, Jira Server
{panel}
*Original request description:*

As a JIRA Administrator I need more granular configuration for my projects:
 # I want to be able to specify different priorities for different projects instead of having a global priority list. The current global priority can be used as a default, but I would like to be able to change them per project.
 # Depending on the issue type, the resolution may be different. For example: in case of bugs, the resolution may be set to "fixed", but in case of improvements there is nothing to fix and the resolution should rather be "implemented". I need to be able to specify the default resolution separately per each issue type.

*Potential Workarounds:*
 There are some workarounds that can provide some solutions to this issue:
 * [Custom fields|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+a+Custom+Field] for priorities and resolutions can be used on a per-project basis.
 * Customizing velocity templates to limit the visible priorities and resolutions per project, similar to what's [posted below|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-3821?focusedCommentId=212921&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-212921] (though this approach does not apply for JIRA Cloud customers).
fields.summary: Priorities per Project and Resolutions per Issue Type

fields.description:
If there is no project selected in a filter and you open the dropdown to filter a status, the list contains all statuses that are used in the system. Is it possible to only show those statuses that are used in projects the current user has access to?

We added a new workflow with many new statuses, but use this workflow only in one project and only few people have permissions for this project. But now when you want to select a status e.g. in the filter "my open issues", everyone has a huge list of statuses he will never use.
fields.summary: Hide status from filter selection list if user doesn't use these statuses

fields.description:
[Allowing connections to JIRA for user management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver076/allowing-connections-to-jira-for-user-management-945110994.html] presents the following options when configuring an application to connect to JIRA:
 * A full IP address, e.g. {{192.168.10.12}}.
 * A wildcard IP range, using CIDR notation, e.g. {{192.168.10.1/16}}.

Using the hostname instead of IP address is possible, however, this is dependent on your DNS server resolving the specified hostname to the IP addresses that the incoming connections are sent from.
fields.summary: Document specifying a hostname when allowing connections to JIRA for user management

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Application Access page crashes if it lists a deleted LDAP group.

h3. Environment
* Jira Server 7.4.4
* Windows Server 2012 R2 
* Microsoft Active Directory (possibly it also breaks with different OS'es and/or LDAP servers)
* Tested and verified on Jira Software 7.12.1, Crowd 3.2.2 and OpenLDAP as well

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h6. On Active Directory
# Create a new group
# Make sure it's created under the Base DN and/or OU Jira syncs with

h6. On Jira
# Confirm whether directory synchronization completed successfully
# Select *Cog > Applications*
# Select *Application access*
# In the *Select group...* dropdown menu, select the new LDAP group

h6. Back on Active Directory
# Find and delete the group

h6. Back on Jira
# Confirm whether directory synchronization completed successfully
# Select *Cog > Applications*
# Select *Application access*


h3. Expected Results
The *Application access* page loads correctly and lists the remaining groups. 

h3. Actual Results
The *Application access* page crashes and get stuck with a message stating *"The group named 'XYZ' does not exist"*. Despite the fact it offers the possibility to refresh the page, the error never goes away making it impossible to manage application access moving forward.

Directory synchronization removes the group information from almost all database tables, except for *licenserolesgroup*. Confirmed by the following query:

{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM licenserolesgroup WHERE group_id = 'deleted_ldap_group';
{code}

h3.NOTE:
This can also be triggered by renaming a Group In external directory, the *group_id* in the *licenserolesgroup* table is not updated to the new Group name, and the origional group is still used.

h3.Workaround 1 
Backend fix requires downtime
# Stop Jira
# Run the following query to exclude the group from *licenserolesgroup*
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM licenserolesgroup WHERE group_id = 'deleted_ldap_group';
{code}
# Re-start Jira

h3.Workaround 2 
Front end fix no restart required
# Create and empty Group in the external directory with the same name as the original group
# Synchronize the directory (end Users may be logged out and need to wait to log back in after the sync completes)
# go to application access and remove the group tied to the new Empty Group 
#- If the group was renamed rather than deleted add the renamed group to allow access for those users
# Delete the Empty group from the external directory for clean up
fields.summary: Application Access page crashes if it lists a deleted LDAP group

The current sub-task Documentation: [Creating issues and sub-tasks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/creating-issues-and-sub-tasks-939938925.html] has no mention of the sub-task limit.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 - the JIRA Cloud code contains some functionality from the Jira Suite Utilities add-on (JSU) such as validators, conditions, and post functions, due to the fact that the JSU add-on was removed from the Marketplace in Cloud, and without these functionalities, some customers would have run into a lot of workflow issues.
 - the JIRA Server code does not contain any of the JSU functionalities, since JIRA Server and Cloud have forked away and use different code
 - When customers migrate from Cloud to Server and are using functionalities from JSU (without being aware of it, since now these functions are part of JIRA Cloud code), some of their workflow transitions will be broken (due to the bug JRASERVER-62284), and they will have to:
 -- manually fix each validator, condition and post function from the JIRA UI
 -- buy a license for the JSU add-on on Server if they want to keep these functions

On our documentation about the migration from [Cloud to Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-938846963.html], the following is mentioned:
{quote}Jira Cloud is typically ahead of Jira Server, which means that some features may not be available after you've moved to Jira Server.
{quote}
However, this information is not sufficient since it is not mentioning that some workflows might break and that installing a new add-on will be necessary.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a banner to the documentation to make it more clear that it might be necessary for some customers to buy a license for JIRA Suite Utilities to keep the same workflow functionalities, and that after the migration, some workflows might become dysfunctional without doing some manual fixes to the workflow in the UI.
fields.summary: Modify the Cloud to Server migration to mention the issues related to the JIRA Suite Utilities

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When a username is too short and there are such users (more than 20) which contains same letters, you are not able to search or add them into watcher or reporter list because search results are only shown for first 20 users randomly and it's not possible to scroll down the results.
h2. Environment
 * JIRA 7.3.8
 * JIRA 7.9.2

h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a JIRA 7.9.2 vanilla instance
 # Create more than 20 users in the environment which has a lot of users and users contain "Li"
 # Go to an issue, type "Li.Li" (it doesn't help even you type full mail address like Li.Li@example.com ) in watcher list. 

h2. Expected Results

Some users which contain "Li" will not be shown in the first 20 of the list and should be found/added by scrolling down.
h2. Actual Results

Some users which contain "Li" will not be shown in the first 20 of the list and can not be found/added.
h2. Workaround
 * To edit username. But this option doesn't help when external LDAP is used. Customers don't want to edit usernames in Active Directory.
 * To add user into the watcher list of an issue via REST API:

{code:java}
Usage:
curl -i -u username:password -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -X POST -d '"username"' http://example.com/rest/api/2/issue/"issue_id"/watchers

Example:
curl -i -u testuser:password123 -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -X POST -d '"Li.Li"' http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/issue/EPIC-5/watchers

Respnse should be like:
HTTP/1.1 204 
X-AREQUESTID: 593x2561x1
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'self'
X-ASEN: SEN-L11898937
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=ED94783AD3429AEFC253FD5DB35247AE;path=/;HttpOnly
X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK
Set-Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=BNWK-JZ8T-U0TV-O6IT|63a6126a208a27bb8017ae4d6cef93d6764ac4a1|lin;path=/
X-ASESSIONID: q32lnz
X-AUSERNAME: testuser
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, no-transform
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
Date: Tue, 03 Jul 2018 09:53:28 GMT
{code}
(i) Reference Link for the REST API: [How to add a user as watcher via REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.3.8/#api/2/issue-addWatcher]

h3. Summary
Creating an issue as a user with no Edit Issue permission fails when setting JPO Team field during issue creation

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Jira Software Project with Sample Data
# Create Shared Teams in Portfolio
# Add the Team field to the Create/Edit/View screens to the project
# Create a new user account
# Ensure that this account has Browse Project / Create Issue permission but not Edit Issue permission
# Log in as the new user account

No workaround

fields.description:
*Use Case:* 

As an admin I am concerned that I am having a problem with incoming or outgoing mail. I need the ability to monitor the health of JIRA's incoming and outgoing email.

*Suggested Change:*

Provide a way for admin to monitor health of incoming and outgoing email. 

Example health metrics and items that could be monitored: 
* Amount of time spent sending one email (perhaps as a histogram or pareto chart)
* Amount of time spent sending/receiving the current message
* Status of each mail handler and mail queue service (if it is currently running, when it last ran)
* Number of emails sent in past hour, past day, and so on.
* Failed message percentage
* Status of mail on each node in JIRA Data Center instances
fields.summary: Add incoming and outgoing mail health monitoring
Provide support for Active Directory Primary group memberships (eg. Domain Users, Domain Admins)

fields.description:
Current documentation on updating Jira - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrading-jira-applications-938846936.html]
 has the methods users can follow to update Jira.

In this document, the last method has the following phrase:
{quote}Low – Medium

_If you use Jira in a non-mission critical environment, depending on your specific installation details, you use either the installer {color:#de350b}(no downtime){color} or manual method to upgrade._
{quote}
This implies that using the installer (bin/exe) does not have downtime for Jira.  This is just flat out incorrect.  In order to update Jira in this method, the java process has to be stopped on the system at some point in order for jira/java/tomcat and lots of other files on the system to be updated.  This phrase should be removed from this specific section because it causes confusion for customers and sets an incorrect expectation about doing the upgrade for Jira.

 

Other versions of this document should also be updated with this change: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ADMINJIRASERVER079/Upgrading+JIRA+applications] etc
fields.summary: Updating jira documentation about (no downtime) phrase

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 21-Nov-2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hello, everyone! After comparing this bug request against the known bug report JRASERVER-67511 Incoming Mail Handler does not respect the default priority in Priorities Scheme we realized that both are addressing the same scenario. We will be closing this request now and will ask you to cast your votes and add any additional feedback so we can have the impact of this issue gathered in one single request.

Best regards,
René Chiquete - JAC Champion.
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary  
Incoming mail with priority flag always sets ticket priority using Default Priority Scheme instead of custom priority scheme.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create new priority scheme using eg. 3 different priorities and associate it with a project
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Set up incoming mail handler and associate it with the project
# Send 3 emails: one with low, other with high and the thrid one without priority set
# Issues get created

h3. Expected Results
Each mail creates a ticket and assign a calculated priority according to the associated priority scheme.

h3. Actual Results
Only mail without priority flag creates ticket with the default priority set from project's priority scheme.
Other two mails create issues and assign priorites which are non-existent in associated priority scheme, but they are defined in Default Priority Scheme.

Example the ticket created from the email sent with High priority flag, the priority has been marked as "(not available)":
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incoming mail with priority flag always sets ticket priority using Default Priority Scheme instead of custom priority scheme

fields.description:
Hello Everyone!

We are about to establish a new Riskmanagement-System in Jira. Therefore it would be very usefull to add custom fields to a Link. The Admin could define a Field Scheme according to a Link Type.

Example:
We want to illustrate that an Event A leads to an Event B with a certain propability P. Therefore we have the Issue Type "Event" and the Link Type "leads to/is caused by". This Link Type could have a Custom Field which is used to select the propability P of "Event A leads to Event B". 

Jira is a really usefull tool for Riskmanagement, even it was not designed for it. With this feature included it would be at least as good as Polarion Risk Pack or other much more expensive tools, which are specially designed for these Use Cases.
Furthermore, this feature would generally increase the capability of Jira's Linking System, not just for Riskmanagement.
fields.summary: Custom Fields for Link Types

fields.description:
h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sandbox project.
 # Setup Incoming Mail handler for issue creation within the sandbox project.
 # Send an email to trigger the incoming mail handler.
 # Observe the priority for the newly created issue on incoming mail.

h2. Expected Behavior
Issue is created with the default priority defined in the Priorities Scheme.

h2. Actual Behavior
Issue is created with the priority defined in the middle of the entire Priorities list.
 Reference: http://<base-url>/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa

h5. Even number
If it's even number, it will select the nth priority returned by the total number divided by 2. In the following example, *Critical* priority will be selected.
 !even-number-priorities.png|thumbnail!

h5. Odd Number
If it's odd number, it will select the middle priority. In the following example, *Fun* priority will be selected.
 !odd-number-priorities.png|thumbnail!

h5. Priority Not Defined in the Priorities Scheme
If the priority is not defined in the associated Priorities Scheme, it will force enter the issue type as *<Priority> (Not Available)*.
!priority-not-available.png|thumbnail!

h2. Notes
Another variant is that if an email is sent with the "high priority" flag, it creates the request with one of the highest priorities using Default Priority Scheme instead of custom priority scheme. This is not solved by any of the workarounds.

h2.Workaround
 * You can rearrange the order of the priorities to set the one you want as default to be in the middle on the global list of priorities at Jira Administration > Issues > Priorities.
 OR
 * You can use the completely free add-on [Workflow Enhancer|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/575829/workflow-enhancer-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview], which adds Universal postfunction to workflows that allows you to evaluate values from fields, and you can use this in the _Create_ transition, adding a post function to evaluate if the priority is out of the project's Priorities, and to set the priority to the one you want as default. For example, setting the result of the evaluation as FALSE, from the following, should do the trick: \{code} \{Priority}
== "Critical" || \{Priority} == "Major" || \{Priority} == "Minor" || \{Priority} == "Trivial" || \{Priority} == "Blocker" \{code}
fields.summary: Incoming Mail Handler does not respect the default priority in Priorities Scheme

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
It is not possible to input UNICODE characters into issue description on Windows while Linux and Mac OSX have no problem inserting the same string. 

Here is the string saved in a file: [^unicode_string.txt] 

h3. *Environment*
Affecting Windows only. 

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Create or edit the issue description of an issue. 
# Paste the string into the issue description. 

h3. *Expected Results*
The issue description is inputted normally as usual. 

h3. *Actual Results*
You will notice that either JIRA will be loading non-stop or the input of the string will be simply ignored and revert back to the previous issue description. 

h3. *Notes*
Please note that this is happening to issue description, the issue comment has no problem. 

h3. *Workaround*
Paste it in a text editor and explicitly save it to UTF-8 encoding, now you should able to input the string by copy and paste it into the issue description.
fields.summary: Not able to input UNICODE characters into issue description on Windows

fields.description:
It would be very beneficial if there were a tool inside of the Scrum boards that allowed you to enter your teams available time for the sprint. For example, my team's sprint ends next Friday, but most of my team is taking next week off. To determine if we have too much of a workload, I have to use Excel or Google Sheets to put in the team's available hours, then compare that to the current workload in the sprint. 

 

I think adding a tool that allows you to add your team members and their available hours would be beneficial. When you are planning your sprint and assigning people to Jira issues, it would be nice if it flagged a team member if you exceed their available hours.

 

[Manage time button|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1T02YneHFg5sWlXKvCeTB-uxkYrBQNP9Y/view?usp=sharing] 

[Manage time window|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1smeQSa7aNCGr9dRo51YVPZq3XRvkCsKZ/view?usp=sharing|http://example.com]
fields.summary: Ability to view team's available hours during sprint planning

fields.description:
Dear support team,

We have some questions about JIRA service desk license.
We are using JIRA core for 2000 users and JIRA software for 50 users. Now, we have planned to use JIRA servicedesk in the company. We are trying to study the integration between JIRA service desk and and JIRA software. we have some questions. 


Firstly, how to escalate ticket to developer (who does have JIRA Software or JIRA Core license only) if the customer creates ticket by using portal, . As I know, helpdesk cannot escalate the ticket to developer directly if they doesn't have JIRA servicedesk license. Is it correct?  However, helpdesk is able to mention the name of developer in the comment and send to internal comment. After that, Jira developer will look into the issue and create new JIRA Software ticket. Then,they will link the issue to the Jira service desk ticket. Is it correct?

Secondly, is it possible to escalte ticket to developer who doesn't have JIRA servicedesk license but they have jira core or JIRA software license. 

Thirdly, do you have on-call support contact number? 

Your fast response will be highly appreciated.

Please let me know if you have any questions. Thank you. 

Best Regards,
Nathasit B.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk integration

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Class {{RequestCachingGroupManager}} may accumulate too many objects in _RequestCache_ during processing large user sets
h3. Environment
 * Large Jira with 50k+ active users

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This is one of the ways to trigger the user search
 # Create 50k users
 # Limit assignable permission for specific _projectA_ for a very small subset of users
 # Trigger assignable user search for _projectA_

REST call:
 # Trigger call to {{user/assignable/search}} (or {{user/assignable/multiProjectSearch}})
 ** Eg: rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?username=&projectKeys=AG&issueKey=AG-13&maxResults=50&startAt=0&_=1529917579021

h3. Expected Results

Memory usage by a thread serving the request a fairly low: up to 100MB
h3. Actual Results
 * Memory usage by a thread serving the request a quite high: 500MB+
 * If a large number of same requests are triggered at the same time, this may lead to OOM error due to exhausting of the heap.

h3. Notes
 * when Jira searches over user base and tries to {{findUsers}} according to specific criteria, it accumulates the different data (usernameToGroups, usernameToGroupNames,usernameToGroupNamesInLowerCase) in _requestCache_ as a side-effect.
 * If user search base is quite large and search criteria is too specific (too strict) than a large number of _Username_ objects will be touched, that will lead to accumulating a large number of objects in _requestCache_ and large memory usage by a thread.
 * Note that when a thread finishes its work memory will be released, so it's not a memory leak.

h3. Workaround
 * None
 * Partial workarounds (if possible):
 ** reduce active base
 ** use more specific search

h3. Note about the fix

The fix is not enabled by default. It will be applied only when [setting the JVM argument|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver076/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-945111794.html]:
{noformat}
-Djira.cache.request.bounded.enabled=true
{noformat}
Jira node restart is required.
To verify that the option was enabled correctly see if the Jira application log contains message:
{noformat}
2019-03-19 15:06:16,969 http-nio-8080-exec-1 INFO anonymous 906x1x1 - 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 / [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheConfiguration] System property jira.cache.request.bounded.enabled is enabled and your requests scope caches are bounded with maxsize=1000
{noformat}

The fix is about introducing the limit to number of objects stored by http request in it's cache. The default limit is 1000, but can be modified by setting JVM argument, e.g.:
{noformat}
-Djira.cache.request.bounded.size=2000
{noformat}
The limit won't be applied if {{jira.cache.request.bounded.enabled}} is not set.
fields.summary: RequestCachingGroupManager may accumulate too many objects in RequestCache during processing large user sets

When attachments are being copy/pasted (CTRL + C > CTRL + V) from Outlook directly into JIRA on a Chrome/IE web browser, it will be uploaded as .tmp files. The files will turn to normal if admins download it, rename it then re-upload it again.

h3. Expected Results

Attachments are uploaded as normal file (as is).

h3. Actual Results

Attachments are uploaded as .tmp files

*On Chrome:*
Error being thrown:
{code}
"An unknown error occured on the browser while trying to attach <unknown>: Cannot read property 'size' of null."
{code}

h3.Workaround
* Use Firefox

fields.description:
Expressions like {{fixVersion > A AND fixVersion < B}} work as expected when an issue has just one Fix version. When there are multiple Fix versions the above expression is interpreted as "has value > A AND has (another) value < B".
 This causes quite a bit of a confusion - see JRASERVER-22995.

It would be useful to be able to specify a "has value between A AND B" kind of condition.

Possible syntax could be as following: {{fixVersion BETWEEN A AND B}} or {{fixVersion IN (A - B)}}.

Here is the full story.

Our project has several components with their own release cycles. So there are versions like 'UI-1.0.13' and 'DL-1.7.0'.
 Occasionally we make a "product release" that includes specific versions of the components: 'R1', 'R2', etc.
 Product releases are "rolling". I.e. individual components could be updated later and "delivered" into 'R1'.
 I would like to be able to filter JIRA issues to see which fixes were delivered in 'Rn' release. And would prefer not having to add a label or an extra 'R1' fix version to every issue.

Some components are quite tightly coupled with the releases. I.e. R2 will likely have 'UI-2.0.x' versions.
 Others are pretty independent. So R2 would have DL-1.7.3 and R3 will use DL-1.7.4
 So using regexp patterns as suggested in JRASERVER-22995 would not quite work.

My idea was to create "marker" versions for product releases: R1, R2, etc.
 And make sure all the components versions are sorted properly with relation to product versions.
 And then a query like "fixVersion between R1 and R2" would easily show me all the changes delivered in the R2 release.

Other options I could think of are:
 - Provide hierarchical versions (at least 1 level deep) and turn all component versions into corresponding product versions children; then filter as {{fixVersion IN R1}}.
 - Implement tags for versions and then filter (quite indirectly) based on something like {{fixVersion.tag = R1}}

I would appreciate if you could suggest a better way to address this.
 But nevertheless I think having "value in range" type of condition would still be useful for JQL.

P.S. It would be great if you could backport this change to JIRA version 7.5.x
fields.summary: JQL: Provide a way to specify "value in the range" condition

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA core as a platfrom doens't handle http/https forward proxy authentication at a platform level.
JIRA relies on built in JVM functionality to handle http/https proxy host and port to initiate the connection, but the JVM doesn't handle authentication with a forward proxy.
The JVM leaved the implementation for authentication to the application code.
In short, the JIRA core code should be able to handle *http.proxyUser* and *http.proxyPassword* on a global level.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.15  
* Configure a forward proxy using basic proxy authentication: eg: squid or apache
* Configure JIRA to use a forward proxy using following start up options:
{code}
-Dhttp.proxyHost=127.0.0.1 -Dhttp.proxyPort=3128 -Dhttp.proxyUser=user -Dhttp.proxyPassword=pass -Dhttps.proxyHost=127.0.0.1 -Dhttps.proxyPort=3128 -Dhttps.proxyUser=user -Dhttps.proxyPassword=pass  -Djdk.http.auth.tunneling.disabledSchemes
{code}
* Plan to configure DVCS pluign to try to connect to github using the proxy.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# After a freshly restarted JIRA
# Login to JIRA as admin
# Go to Applications and try to configure DVCS to connect to github


h3. Expected Results
* JIRA is able to connect to github and verify the user account.

h3. Actual Results
* JIRA fails to connect to github and user is faced with a connection/access error.
* In the logs we see warnings like this:
{code}
2018-05-24 11:27:15,178 http-nio2-13032-exec-44 WARN admin 687x111223x1 1q8lhhh IP,IP,IP /secure/admin/AddGithubOrganization!finish.jspa [c.a.j.p.d.s.github.webwork.AddGithubOrganization] Caused by: Unable to tunnel through proxy. Proxy returns "HTTP/1.1 407 Proxy Authentication Required"
{code}


h3. Notes
* You need to avoid doing any other functionality before doing the DVCS configuration to be able to see the error.
* JIRA core doesn't initialize system wide java.net.Authenticator.setDefault(.Authenticator auth) with an [Authenticator object |http://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk8/jdk8/jdk/file/687fd7c7986d/src/share/classes/java/net/Authenticator.java]. 
This static method could be used to populate the needed Proxy-Authorization header to allow the connection to pass through the proxy.  

h3.Workaround
* For the time being, a working workaround for this is to rely on lower level implementations that would set a system wide authenticator object for JIRA, a good working example for this is the *JIRA Log Analyzer plugins* (Hercules).
If we access the Log Analyzer page before getting to DVCS configuration, a system wide authenticator will be initialized and will be used by any other implementation until JIRA is restarted.

With Debug logging for {{HttpURLConnection}} enabled (see KB [enable debug logging for outgoing-http-connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-enable-debug-logging-for-outgoing-http-connections-in-jira-952073102.html]): 
* Non-working example: note  _Authentication returned: null_
{noformat}
17-Jun-2018 15:22:02.833 FINEST [http-nio-8081-exec-8] sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection$1.run Requesting Authentication: host =172.16.47.128 url = https://api.github.com/users/atlamstest
17-Jun-2018 15:22:02.834 FINEST [http-nio-8081-exec-8] sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection$1.run Authentication returned: null
17-Jun-2018 15:22:02.834 FINER [http-nio-8081-exec-8] sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getHttpProxyAuthentication Proxy Authentication for AuthenticationHeader: prefer Basic realm="Password Required" returned null
{noformat}
* Working example: _Authentication returned: java.net.PasswordAuthentication@23fa1ec4_
{noformat}
17-Jun-2018 15:26:02.039 FINEST [hercules] sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection$1.run Requesting Authentication: host =172.16.47.128 url = https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/179443532/jira_regex_v2.xml
17-Jun-2018 15:26:02.039 FINEST [hercules] sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection$1.run Authentication returned: java.net.PasswordAuthentication@23fa1ec4
17-Jun-2018 15:26:02.041 FINER [hercules] sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getHttpProxyAuthentication Proxy Authentication for AuthenticationHeader: prefer Basic realm="Password Required" returned sun.net.www.protocol.http.BasicAuthentication@6515e4a2
{noformat}

There is currently no grantee that the above workaround would continue to work, other plugins can actually override this system wide authenticator using the above static method and prevent the system form working if the plugin have bad code.

*Please note* that the above problem mainly affects code using *java.net* API eg: DVCS/Eclipse egit or Log Analyzer using the *HttpUrlConnection* class, Apache HttpClient uses different ways to implement proxy authentication.
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't handle http forward proxy authentication globally

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When JIRA has an issue linked around 300+ issues, it tooks around 12~20 seconds for JIRA REST API to retrieve the json data. *The problem only observed in Oracle not other database.*

Enable JProfiler and can see most of the request are coming from:
{code}
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. SELECT pkey, issuenum, PROJECT, REPORTER, ASSIGNEE, CREATOR, issuetype, SUMMARY, DESCRIPTION, ENVIRONMENT, PRIORITY, RESOLUTION, issuestatus, CREATED, UPDATED, DUEDATE, RESOLUTIONDATE, VOTES, WATCHES, TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE, TIMEESTIMATE, TIMESPENT, WORKFLOW_ID, SECURITY, FIXFOR, COMPONENT FROM jiraissue WHERE ID=?
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeQuery
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.select
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.select
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.findByPrimaryKey
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.findByPrimaryKey
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.findByPrimaryKey
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findByPrimaryKey
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findByPrimaryKey
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findById
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.findById
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.getIssue
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.getIssueObject
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.RequestCachingIssueManager.getIssueObject
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.IssueLinkImpl.getIssueObject
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.IssueLinkImpl.getDestinationObject
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager._getLinkCollection
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.getLinkCollection
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.rest.json.beans.IssueLinksBeanBuilder.buildIssueLinks
41.7% - 1,685 ms - 624 hot spot evt. com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.IssueLinksSystemField.getJsonFromIssue
{code}

h3. Environment
* Oracle 12C

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect JIRA to Oracle 12c
# Restore a backup that has an issue with 300+ issues linked to it.
# Trigger the REST API below:
{code}
date; curl -u admin:sphere -X GET $BASE_URL/rest/api/2/issue/PAG-3106; date;
{code}
or paste the uri $BASE_URL/rest/api/2/issue/PAG-3106 through the web browser

h3. Expected Results
*Oracle 12c took around 1~2 seconds* - 7.6.1
*Oracle 12c took around 1~2 seconds* - 7.10.1

h3. Actual Results
*Oracle 12c took around 12~20 seconds* - 7.6.1
*Oracle 12c took around 12~25 seconds* - 7.10.1

h3. Note

In Postgres db, JIRA took around 1~2 seconds to retrieve the information.

h3.Workaround

Change to other supported database.
fields.summary: Retrieving 300+ issue linked via REST API is slow in Oracle DB

fields.description:
When Using Fix Version Drop Down Auto-complete With Dash (Product-7.1.2), It Did Not Show Auto-Complete When Insert Version Numbers.

h3.*Summary*
When we set versions with dash such as *JIRA-7.1.0*, JIRA auto-complete suggestion will not provide suggestion when we insert partial of the version such as 7.1.0. It will only show suggestion when we insert full version such as JIRA-7... 
h3.*Environment*
JIRA Version: Tested on JIRA 7.10.1, should impact to all JIRA version before this as well.
h3.*Steps to Reproduce*
# Configure a few versions with ProductName-x.y.z format. For example, jira-6.4.5, jira-7.0.0, and jira-7.1.0.
# Configure version with ProductName x,y,z format (the dash *-* changed to space), for example myproduct 1.1.0, myproduct 2.0.0, and myproduct 2.1.6 
(i) Versions created in 1st steps are unable to search using auto-complete when we insert fix version with 6.4.5 ir 7.0.0, 7.1.0.
(i) The Version created in 2nd steps are able to search using auto-complete when we insert fix version with 1.1.0, or 2.0.0.

h3.*Workaround*
Use full version (include product name) to search instead of only insert numbers

h3.*Expected Results*
JIRA auto-complete to provide suggestion no matter we are using which version formatting.

h3.*Actual Results*
It does not return auto-complete suggestion accordingly.

(i) Using productname x,y,z format.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

(i) Using productname-x,y,z format.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When Using Fix Version Drop Down Auto-complete With Dash (Product-7.1.2), It Did Not Show Auto-Complete When Insert Version Numbers.

fields.description:
*Summary -*
When using an add-on executes functions using parallel threads such as deleting issues, Postgres goes into a deadlock situation.

*How to replicate -*
Using Automation for Jira
# Set up a rule trigger to use JQL to find issues 20+
# Action set as Delete Issue
# Make sure the *Process all issues produced by this trigger in bulk* is unticked (to force parallel threads)
# Run rule to delete.

*Expected result -*
All issues found by the JQL will be deleted.

*Actual result -*
Some issues get deleted but then Postgres throws an error -
{code}

fields.description:
Configure a JIRA with an LDAP user directory. Works great.

Try to edit the existing connection in order to change the LDAP password. See that all the parameters configured in the whole section are now blank.

What was a simple task to replace a password is now a major outage, as we have to reconfigure LDAP from scratch.
fields.summary: Fix the LDAP User Directory "Edit" button to not wipe out all the settings

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Loading a Confluence page which has 20 or more pie chart gadgets and that is connected to a *busy* JIRA instance leads to failing to load some of those gadgets with the errors shown below.

JIRA does not find the temporary file created in {{JIRA_DATACENTER_SHARED_FOLDER}}\caches\charts and returns the error "File not found" to Confluence, however the temporary file is later created and not deleted as the operation trying to load the file had completed before.

(i) Please note there is a different problem with similar symptoms - JRASERVER-72881

h3. Confluence page error

!confluence_page_1.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. JIRA log error

{code}
2018-02-02 04:37:54,779 http-nio-80-exec-36 WARN anonymous 277x91142x3 - 10.25.192.102,10.25.192.13 /charts [c.a.j.charts.jfreechart.DisplayChartServlet] File not found, returning 404 (filename='jfreechart-onetime-83880084426271604.png').
{code}


h2. Environment

* JIRA Data Center
(It was reproduced in JIRA Software 7.2.7 and 7.2.13)
* Confluence
(It was reproduced in Confluence 5.10.8)


h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Confluence page with many pie chart gadgets (at least 20)
# Connect the Confluence instance to the JIRA instance
(!) It is important to note that the load in the JIRA instance has to be high in order to reproduce the issue.
# Load the Confluence page (which will request JIRA to generate the temporary images to show the pie chart)


h2. Expected Results

# JIRA will return all the charts requested by loading the data needed and creating a temporary file for each gadget that in the end is the chart returned to Confluence.
# Once the temporary files are used they should be deleted from the JIRA DC shared folder.


h2. Actual Results

* When loading the Confluence page some of the gadgets are not loading and the below error is shown.
!confluence_page_1.PNG|thumbnail!

*For those temporary files that are not shown in the Confluence page the below error is shown in the JIRA log files.
{code}
2018-02-02 04:37:54,779 http-nio-80-exec-36 WARN anonymous 277x91142x3 - 10.25.192.102,10.25.192.13 /charts [c.a.j.charts.jfreechart.DisplayChartServlet] File not found, returning 404 (filename='jfreechart-onetime-83880084426271604.png').
{code}

* The same file that is shown as file not found in the JIRA log file is later created in the JIRA shared folder and not deleted. (See highlighted examples below).


h2. Workaround

It is possible to delete these files left in the JIRA Data Center shared folder/directory as they should be deleted once the image is rendered.
fields.summary: Temporary files are not deleted after loading and rendering a pie chart

fields.description:
We have over 700 custom fields and we are adding more every week. The screen already takes some time to load, and is difficult to search for a field, since some of the associates screens include the field name o something related.

It would be very helpful to have some kind of menu or dropdown to show the fields by their first letter, and include a  "view all" option in case you need to show them all.
fields.summary: Custom Fields Screen Split

fields.description:
In the Configure Custom Field -> Modify configuration scheme context Screen > Choose applicable context Section is very difficult to select projects when there are more than 500 items. 

The text area is very small, and is very difficult to add more projects after you create the context for the first time, since all the selected projects are placed at the bottom, so you have to carefully select each of the new project without unselecting the others.

A two boxes approach could be a better option, where you transfer the required projects from one box to another.
fields.summary: Modify configuration scheme context Screen - Choose applicable context Section

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Current Jira doesn't show the state/status of the zero downtime upgrade flow.

h3. Suggested Solution
* When performing a ZDU, it would be good having Jira showing the current state/status of the process in the upgrade page, something that would answer questions like:
** What nodes is it expecting to see upgraded?
** What is it waiting on?
** What versions are they at now? (like a status list)

It would help Administrators identify pending/current/next steps.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Jira Datacenter should show current state of ZDU upgrade flow

fields.description:
As a user and administrator of Jira Dashboards

I want the Version Report Widget to allow selection of the earliest unreleased Version

So that I do not have to manually update dashboards every time we close versions, and create new versions.
fields.summary: JIRA Dashboard Version Report Widget

fields.description:
When using the Project Import tool if one or more custom fields has a null value in a field where an issue ID is expected the below message is shown:

*No 'issue' field for CustomfieldValue 'xxxxxx'*

Suggestion:
Points the customer to the article:
- [Project import fails with No 'issue' field for CustomFieldValue xxxx|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/project-import-fails-with-no-issue-field-for-customfieldvalue-xxxx-293831070.html]
fields.summary: Point the customer to the fix when project import fails with No 'issue' field for CustomfieldValue message

fields.description:
The current handling of attachments is pretty minimal. They are unorganized, the 'Attachment' widget is overly generic, can only be used once per screen and can't describe what a user is expected to attach during a particular transition screen.

Take a purchase order workflow, for example. I would like to create these custom fields to contain PDFs:
 * Quote
 * Purchase Order
 * Invoice
 * Receipt

So when an employee submits a request for a purchase order, they would use the Quote custom field to attach a quote for the thing they want ordered. In the next step, the purchasing dept would create a PO pdf and use the Purchase Order custom field to attach it for review. And so on for the invoice and the receipt.

Then, someone viewing the ticket can quickly identify each component, they can show the filenames (maybe even with links!) as a column in the Issue Navigator, I can put attachments on different tabs and, essentially, design and tailor things the way I can with most other aspects of Jira.

All these attachments can still end up in the big ol' attachment 'bin' shown in each Issue – that would be fine since I could now use those custom fields in the View screen to organize attachments how I want elsewhere in the view.

I feel this would greatly enhance workflow flexibility, and be extremely helpful in use cases which require a lot of attachments.
fields.summary: Add Attachment Custom Fields

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
For Oracle 12c, we cannot use different username and schema like we have with other database types as it has defaulted the schema to the username. 

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Allow the option like <schema-name></schema-name> for Oracle 12c as well. 

h3. *Why this is important*
For Oracle EUS, you will be required to create another username and to use this username in the existing Oracle JIRA database is not possible as JIRA by default will look for schema name same as the username.
fields.summary: Add support for Oracle 12c Enterprise User Security (EUS)

fields.description:
*Issue description*

Currently, when moving an issue to a different issue type (or project), the Moving Issue screen ignores the default value defined in the page  *⚙ > Issues > Configure Custom Field*, and the user needs to enter the value themselves.

*Steps to reproduce*

- Set a default value for a text field in ⚙ > Issues > Configure Custom Field, and change the context of this field to make only visible to Issue Type B:
 !Step1.png|thumbnail! 
- Create an issue with issue type A
- Move the issue from Issue Type A to Issue Type B
- Notice that on the "Move Issue: Updated Fields" and "Move Issue: Confirm", the text field is empty and the default value is not picked up:
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 
 !Step3.png|thumbnail! 

*Note:*

When creating a new issue using the Issue Type B, the default value is picked up. It's because the default value is only applied when creating a new issue, but not when moving a new issue:
 !Step4.png|thumbnail! 

*Suggested solution*

Enable Jira to configure what are the default values for fields in the move issue screen.

One way to implement this feature would be to force the "Move Issue" screen to use the Default field value which is configured in ⚙ > Issues > Configure Custom Field
fields.summary: Add the option to configure a default value for field in move issue screen

fields.description:
1., In 'jira/bin/setup_user.sh' the permission setting line is:
`chmod +x "$install_dir"/bin/*.sh`

Not specifying the target (i.e. 'ugo+x') this won't affect the bits in umask, so if you have for example 'umask 077', then the .sh files will get only 0700, and Jira won't start ever.

Solution: `chmod ugo+x ...` in setup_user.sh

2., The installer creates `/etc/init.d/Jira` script, but doesn't notify systemd to create a service wrapper around it, so `systemctl status Jira` finds nothing until the next reboot.

Solution: add `systemctl daemon-reload` at the end of the installer

3., As a User I'd like to be able to File Bug Reports, just like for any decent public project.
The message 'User ... has no Assign Issue permission' is not too useful.

Having this 'Suggestion' interface while we're talking about an issue tracker is ... awkward.
fields.summary: Installer sets wrong script permissions, service rescanning missing

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able add more information such as the sub-task/linked issue assignee than just the _Issue-key_, _Issue-type_, _Priority_ and _Status_.

 

Currently it is not possible to add more information on that section.
!image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a project manager, I want to be able to add more details regarding Sub-tasks and linked issues in the Issue Detailed View section

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

Switching to a different issue while an image attachment is uploading attaches the image to the wrong issue.

h3. Environment 
Tested on Jira 7.7.0, 7.7.1, 7.10.0, and 7.10.1 with Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce 

# Open the issue navigator UI (the one with issue list on the left and details on the right)
# Open issue A
# Paste a big image to the comment, the image is big enough to take a few seconds to upload.
# Cancel the comment and the image keeps uploading in the background. We only need the attachment not the comment itself.
# Navigate to another issue B using keyboard shortcut j/k
# Wait until the upload is done and a popup notification is showing. It says attachment is uploaded to issue A, which is the correct one
# Move to issue A with j/k and verify that image is not attached there
# Move to issue B and verify that image is wrongly attached there

h3. Expected Results 

Image is attached to the issue that it was dragged into.

h3. Actual Results 

Image is attached to the issue that was navigated to during upload.

h3. Workaround 

Do not navigate to a new issue during attachment upload.
fields.summary: Image attached to wrong issue if navigate to a different issue before uploading is done

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30777].
{panel}
When the language configured in JIRA is different with the Machine OS, exporting filter to excel will cause the date mismatch in term of format and display.

JIRA should parse the Date format in number(perhaps something) rather than the date as the Excel will use the Regional Language in the Machine.

Example:-
JIRA's Language = English
 !im2.PNG!
Machine OS's Language = Dutch (Belgium)
 !im3.PNG!
When exporting Date Custom Field in JIRA which is supposed to be dd/MMM/yy
 !im1.PNG!

Result:-
 !im4.PNG!
Expected Result:-
The Date in Excel should all be consistence but due to some conversion made by Excel based on Regional Language of OS's Language.

Workaround:-
 # Use Google Excel Sheet (Ensure you are using English) / Excel 2016 (Tested it will automatically convert date time accordingly)
 # Open Google Excel
 # Select *File > Import > Upload > Upload the CSV file*
 # Once import completed, it will prompt up a screen asking for more details, update the *Separator type* accordingly.
 !image-2018-06-14-21-17-53-047.png|thumbnail!
 # Click on import data and open it
 # The wrong date data will be imported to Google Excel, we will need to select 2 columns which having wrong date format.
 !image-2018-06-14-21-19-41-817.png|thumbnail!
 # Select *Format > Number > Date Time* and all date column will be formatted accordingly.

(i) Another workaround is to set the same language in JIRA and the computer operating system to have same time format. However, this shouldn't be workable for some user as we might not have control over their computer configurations.
fields.summary: Inconsistency date Export using Date Custom Field with different Language Configured

fields.description: h3. Summary When a notification email sent about a comment containing an in-line image is opened in the desktop version of Outlook (2010 or 2016), the image is cropped and only the bottom part of it is loaded. Note that: - this issue only occurs with the Windows Desktop version of Outlook and not the web version of Outlook. - this issue only occurs with JIRA Core Emails (and not with Service Desk Customer Emails which use a different template) h3. Steps to reproduce - Install the Outlook app on a Windows server (for example Outlook 2010) - Enable Outlook app to automatically download images from Trust Center Settings -> Automatic Download - Log in JIRA in Internet Explorer (v11) with Remember me checked, so that Outlook app can use the cookie to authenticate against JIRA - Trigger an email notification with a thumbnail attachment, then another email with a full image attachment - Open the email notification in Outlook h3. Expected Results The image from the comment is cropped and only the bottom part is loaded: !outlookapp.png|thumbnail! h3. Actual Results The full image from the comment should be loaded, like it's the case on the web version of Outlook: !outlookwebthumb.png|thumbnail! !outlookwebfull.png|thumbnail! h3. Reason We found from [this forum|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8980956/line-height-not-working-in-outlook-2010-for-html-email] that the reason why the cropping is happening with Outlook is because Outlook supports line-height specified in percents. For example, line-height: 20px isn't supported, but line-height: 110% is. If we look into the source of an example of JIRA notification, we can see that the properties "line-height: 20px; mso-line-height-rule: exactly;" are used: {code:java} XXXXX commented on TEST-7 {code} Because the line-height properly is in px and not in percentage, the mso-line-height-rule is not properly interprated by Outlook and the image is cropped To fix this issue, the CSS of the email template should: - either set the line-height property with a percentage value (for example, changing "line-height: 20px; mso-line-height-rule: exactly;" to "line-height: 100%; mso-line-height-rule: exactly;" fixes the issue) - or remove the properly mso-line-height-rule from the CSS if the line-height property can't be set to a percentage value h3. Workaround The workaround would consists in modifying the CSS of the notification email located in the /atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/ as explained in [Customizing email content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/customizing-email-content-861253783.html?_ga=2.150501622.1939346461.1528698174-1469285456.1509719284] but *this method is a customization of JIRA, therefore not supported by Atlassian Support*
fields.summary: Image is cropped (almost the whole part) when opening email notification in Outlook 2010 or 2016
